title: Education
description:
Overcoming user inertia to a change through education. There are 16 different forms of inertia and many can be overcome directly with education.

Don't underestimate this.
benefit: +2% for your marketshare

title: Creating Artificial Needs
description: Creating and elevating an artificial need through marketing and behavioural influence. Take a rock and make it a pet etc.
benefit: +2% for your marketshare

title: Confusion of choice
description: Preventing users from making rational decisions by overwhelming them with choice.
benefit: -5% to your competitors marketshare

title: Fear Uncertainty and Doubt
description: Creating fear, uncertainty and doubt over a change in order to slow it down. Often used to slow evolution by exploiting inertia to change within customers and forcing new entrants to divert energy away from the components and into countering the accusations.
benefit: +20% cost increase for a single component evolution from product to utility.

title: Artificial Competition
description: Spawning fake competitor companies with similar products. Creating two competing bodies to become the focus of competition and in effect driving oxygen out of a market.
benefit: -5% to your competitors marketshare

title: Lobbying Counterplay
description: Persuading Government of a favorable position

title: Open approaches
description: Encouraging competition through open source, open data, open APIs, open processes by removing barriers to adoption and encouraging a focus for competition.
benefit: -5% cost on a single component evolution for everyone

title: IPR
description: Preventing competitors from developing a space including ring fencing a competitor.
benefit: +20% cost a single, owned component for others to adapt

title: Pig in a poke
description:
Creating a situation where others believe the toxic asset has long term value and disposing of it through sale before the toxicity reveals itself.
Condition:
This component has to be under the market level.
benefit: 5% cost on a single component adoption, Gain $300,000

title: Disposal of liability
description:
Overcoming the internal inertia to disposal. Your own organisation is likely to fight you even when you're trying to get rid of the toxic.
Condition:
The Time Point cost depends on Doctrine levels. Only on components that are behind the market.
benefit: -20% cost on a single component adoption

title: Sweat and Dump
description:
Exploiting a 3rd party to take over operating the toxic asset whilst you prepare to remove yourself.
Condition:
this component has to be under the market level. you're giving the asset operation to a third party, thus you have to pay extra cost for its usage
benefit: -30% cost on a single component adoption, component cost increase +5%

title: Differentiation
description:
Creating a visible difference through user needs.
Condition:
must be a valid user need. judges decide
benefit: +2% market share (on total), +2% product cost increase

title: Pricing policy
description: Exploiting supply and demand effects including price elasticity, Jevons paradox and constraints including fragmentation plays.
benefit: Reducing/Increasing your product price (any value)

title: Signal Distortion
description: Exploiting commonly used signals in the market by manipulation of analysts to create a perception of change.
benefit: false news on moving the PR->UT, CB -> PR, or R->CB

title: Threat acquisition
description:
Buying up those companies that may threaten your market.
Condition:
Depends on the phase.
benefit: increase cost on moving from product to commodity, custom built to product 30% for one component of choice

title: Raising barriers to entry
description: Increasing expectations within a market for a range of user needs to be met in order to prevent others entering the market.
benefit: increase cost on moving from product to commodity, custom built to product 30% for one component of choice

title: Procrastination
description: Do nothing
benefit: Wait, Accumulate Cash

title: Defensive regulation
description: Using Government's to create protection for your market and slow down competitors.
benefit: Negate competitor's next move positive marketshare gain.

title: Directed investment
description: VC approach to a specific or identified future change (any component - future / past)
benefit: -30% cost for moving a single component from product to commodity and CB to product

title: Experimentation
description: VC approach to a specific or identified future change (any component - future / past)
benefit: -30% cost for moving a single component from product to commodity and CB to product

title: Creating centers of gravity
description: Creating a focus of talent to encourage a market focus on your organisation
benefit:
+4% marketshare
-10% adoption cost for everyone to adopt your advanced component

title: Undermining barriers to entry
description:
Identifying a barrier to entry into a market and reducing it to encourage competition.
Condition:
Your chosen component is in front of the market.
benefit:
+5% on your marketshare (based on the current one)
-30% cost for everyone to adopt your advanced component.

title: Sensing Engines (ILC)
description:
A mechanism of being the first mover to industrialise a component, allowing others (the ecosystem) to build new industries upon it and then using consumption data to determine candidates for industrialisation.
Condition:
Only applicable on Product type components.
benefit:
-50% cost on evolving one
component from Product
to Commodity
